comments.body: Can we not put this in a test framework utility package and import that instead?
I've opened for https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/83937 for that. In the meantime, can we backport this less intrusive solution?

Could you add the `NOTE` here to explain why this code needs to be copied from the common?
I guess someday someone will find these functions are duplicated and try merging them into a single like reverting, then this problem can happen again.
So it is nice to add the `NOTE` here to avoid that.

@oomichi  Thanks for review time. I agree with your comments.

I pushed a new revision with these NOTEs added.
I think we don't need to test both pre-provisioned and dynamic volumes, they should behave the same in this suite.
@mkimuram commented [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/81375#issuecomment-521041120) that the failure handling is different between preprovisioned and dynamic
Very good idea to speed up tests without any risks of flake! Let's apply similar way to other places to speed up tests later in another commit.
Don't this skip these tests in all clusters?
hmm, nvm. Looks like this suite itself has `Feature:` tag.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +343,347 @@
		// TODO: This skip should be removed once #70760 is fixed
		skipTestUntilBugfix("70760", input.driverName, []string{"csi-hostpath", "com.google.csi.gcepd"})

		By("Creating sc")
